name: Jedediah Hawkins Inn & Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the rooms to the food this place is truly amazing. Our room was beautiful and so comfortable, and the cozy robes and korres bath products really made everything feel so luxurious. The food was INCREDIBLE, and the restaurant is absolutely beautiful. From what I gather the chef started in 2010 and the restaurant went under full renovations before reopening as Luce and Hawkins. The wait staff was very professional and everything from the wine to the food was simply out of this world.
reviews.title: GREAT place to stay or eat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went in November which was lovely and cozy (fireplace in the room!), and cannot wait to revisit this Spring and see the garden and grounds in full swing. All in all a great place to get away for the weekend.
reviews.title: Good but well short of great; perhaps it was an off night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not stay at the inn but did have dinner at the restaurant. We were told by several people that Jedediah Hawkins is The place to dine on the North Fork. It was good, but not as good as we were told to expect.
reviews.title: Perfect BnB with incredible food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dining room is gorgeous, and spacious but cozy. The service was excellent. As for the food, however, we assume from difference between the reputation and our experience that were there on an off night, or when the chef had the night off.
reviews.title: If you're a foodie, this Inn is a spectacular experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: She-e had the Deviled Eggs appetizer, which consisted of pureed Ahi and caviar. It was an interesting taste sensation, but, served ice-cold, probably would have made a more positive impression had the temperature outside not been in the low teens. She also had the special flash-fried Branzino and enjoyed it very much. He-e had the fish chowder appetizer, which was thin, and the lamb shank, which though served in a crock pot was only luke warm, and quite bland.
reviews.title: go see , eat , stay and enjoy !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a get away day & evening on two occasions. It pairs one of the best dining establishments on Long Island with a enticing B&B experience. Meals are excellent. Located in the North Fork wine area. Perfect to do the winery excursion and then stay the night.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel all the time and have seen/stayed in some of the leading hotels in the world. So, it usually takes a lot to impress me when it comes to service and experience...
reviews.title: Excellent, excellent experience
Grossly Overrated!
reviews.text: Jedediah Hawkin Inn and its restaurant, Luce + Hawkin, restored my faith in the American Inn experience this past weekend. We had a wonderful time from the minute we set down out bags until we were packed away in our car (Long Island pumpkin in hand, Keith Luce gave it to us as a parting gift when I expressed an interest in his delicious roasted pumpkin seeds that were sprinkled on my steel-cut oatmeal at breakfast... Totally unnecessary but totally appreciated, of course!!!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sarah, Keith and the entire staff at this establishment were amazing. The rooms were amazing (and I think we had the 'worst' one as it was right over the bar. This was no problem, the bar was small and they provided a white noise machine just in case we had trouble sleeping -- we didn't). The decor and ambiance of the house -- wonderful.
reviews.title: Love the JHI!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food. Oh my. The food. Not since eating at Viajanta in East London before my husband and I moved back to the US have I experienced such amazingly experimental but comforting food all at the same time. Everything we ate there was delicious. We only planned to eat in Luce + Hawkin one night but it was so good on our first night that we immediately booked our second. Well worth it. Do note, however, the wine has 750ml prices but each bottle is only 500ml (it did say this on the menu, we just didn't notice. That would be my only complaint, which is a rarity for me...)
reviews.title: Ok, but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned form a two night stay at Jedediah Hawkins. When we drove up it looked picture perfect. The property is lovely. It has a little garden, duck pond, art gallery and a pretty wrap around porch.
reviews.title: What A Great Find!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Rose Room. I loved it because it was bright and airy. Each room was decorated by a different designer so they are all beautiful and unique. We stayed with friends and they commented that they loved their rooms but they were dark during the day.
reviews.title: Very beautiful and relaxing inn on the North Fork

reviews.text: The food was out of this world. I had no idea when I booked that the restaurant was such high caliber. The chef worked in the White House during the Clinton administration. We had dinner there one night and breakfast in the morning. Breakfast was great!! It was a 10 course tasting menu. We sat family style and we were served the chef's creations. It was a great experience.
reviews.title: Bountiful BIG Breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was also wonderful. They were kind, friendly and very accommodating. Paul, the manager, went out of his way to answer our questions and help us with activities.
reviews.title: Fun Place to Stay in NY Wine Country / Killer Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really appreciated that they served their own tripled filtered water. It was served in old fashioned milk containers during dinner and in the rooms. It was nice not having to spend extra money on bottled water plus not using plastic!!!!
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Inn But Restaurant Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the property is beautiful and the staff lovely and accommodating I expected more based on reviews and price. The bedrooms are nice and the food is good, but neither were exceptional. The main areas of the inn are warm and inviting and the bed was very comfy. Contrary to a prior reviewer the inn does provide toiletries which were quite satisfactory. The staff really shine which is worth noting again. Issues: Beware staying below the Belvedere suite. There seems to be no soundproofing, and a guest above us clomped around in heels from early morning on and repeatedly dropped heavy objects on the wooden floor above our heads. Sleeping late was not an option despite the white noise machine. Also, the shower had little water pressure. Temperature control in the room was challenging as well, either too hot or too cold.
reviews.title: Nice but overall experience fell short of expectations

reviews.text: Just left the beautiful inn! We stayed in the Beveldere Suite and can I tell you, breath taking! Restored perfectly including radiant heat in the bathroom!
reviews.title: Perfect romantic weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also enjoyed dinner at the restaurant as well. The food was fabulous with every attention given to details!
reviews.title: Second Trip To JHH - Loved It More Than The First

reviews.text: The wineries are a short drive away. Also cute little shops too!
reviews.title: Very good food.Outstanding atmophere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was really a perfect romantic weekend trip that I would recommend.
reviews.title: Amazing !!!!!!

aka: Jedediah Hawkins Inn & Restaurant Hotel Jamesport
description: Nestled among the farms and the vineyards of the North Fork's wine country, Jedediah Hawkins Inn & Restaurant is a stunning historic property,known for its luxurious accommodations, genuine hospitality and exceptional food.
